attributes.action: Stop non-essential retailers opening on Boxing Day
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Plenty of people seem to flock to the Boxing Day sales, but I doubt they spare a thought for the staff of these shops that are more often than not 'coerced' into working it.

Christmas and Boxing Day represent a time that would traditionally be spent with family; and these values are rapidly being eroded in our evermore commercialised World.

I doubt many of the people attending these sales would like to be working Boxing Day, so let's allow all shop-workers the opportunity to spend two days at home instead of just the one.

Very few, if any shops are open on Christmas Day; I guess it'll only be a matter of time before this custom is over-turned so that the swarming mobs can get to their 'Bargains'
